H0.text: Liter is the unit of measurement the student should most likely use to accurately measure the distance from the floor to the ceiling in a classroom.

H1.text: Kiloliter is the unit of measurement the student should most likely use to accurately measure the distance from the floor to the ceiling in a classroom.

H2.text: Meter is the unit of measurement a student should most likely use to accurately measure the distance from the floor to the ceiling in a classroom.

H3.text: Kilometer is the unit of measurement that the student should most likely use to accurately measure the distance from the floor to the ceiling in a classroom.

A4.text: The metre is the base unit of length in the International System of Units (SI).

A5.text: Long distances are usually expressed in km, astronomical units (149,597,871 km), light-years (63,000 au; 9.5 trillion km), or parsecs (210,000 au; 31 trillion km), rather than in Mm or larger multiples.
